derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English mīn, of Germanic origin; related to me and to Dutch mijn and German mein
late Middle English: from Old French mine (noun), miner (verb), perhaps of Celtic origin; compare with Welsh mwyn 'ore', earlier 'mine'

encyclopedia.content: 寐(MINE)家居中国家纺十大品牌 寐(MINE)家居中国家纺十大品牌，家纺加盟首选梦洁寐牌，提供家纺加盟指导，家纺品牌加盟，家纺加盟政策，家纺品牌加盟费，家纺加盟条件，入选高端家纺十大品牌。"寐MINE"介绍 "寐MINE"集研发、生产和销售为一体，以"全球精选"为品牌的核心理念，在全球范围内搜寻最高标准的原材料，采用最先进、最苛刻的工艺，致力于为全球用户提供高品质家居用品，传播时尚家居文化

entry.tran: (第一人称单数所有格代词)我的(东西)
entry.def: Mine is the first person singular possessive pronoun. A speaker or writer uses mine to refer to something that belongs or relates to himself or herself.

example.ex: Her right hand is inches from mine...
example.tran: 她的右手和我的手挨得很近。

example.ex: That wasn't his fault, it was mine...
example.tran: 那不是他的错，是我的错。

entry.def: A mine is a place where deep holes and tunnels are dug under the ground in order to obtain a mineral such as coal, diamonds, or gold.
When a mineral such as coal, diamonds, or gold is mined, it is obtained from the ground by digging deep holes and tunnels.

example.ex: The pit is being shut down because it no longer has enough coal that can be mined economically.
example.tran: 这座煤矿即将关闭，因为从经济上考虑，矿井里已经没有足够的煤可供开采。

example.ex: ...the finest gems, mined from all corners of the world.
example.tran: 从世界各地采掘来的最精美的宝石

entry.def: A mine is a bomb which is hidden in the ground or in water and which explodes when people or things touch it.
If an area of land or water is mined, mines are placed there which will explode when people or things touch them.

example.ex: The approaches to the garrison have been heavily mined.
example.tran: 通往要塞的道路都已布满地雷。

entry.def: If you say that someone is a mine of information, you mean that they know a great deal about something.

means.word_mean: 1. excavation in the earth from which ores and minerals are extracted
